entry.title: CBDC: Reserve Bank Of India Urges More Lenders To Embrace Digital Rupee, Sources Say
entry.summary:
In an effort to enhance the adoption of the Central Bank Digital Currency (CBDC) and explore the potential of digital currencies, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has urged more lenders to participate in digital currency pilot programs.
With trials of the CBDC, known as e-rupees, already underway since last year, the RBI aims to achieve a target of one million CBDC transactions per day by the end of this year.
Pilot Program Expansion
Amid the ongoing pilot programs involving major state-owned and private lenders, such as State Bank of India, Bank of Baroda, ICICI Bank, HDFC Bank, Kotak Mahindra Bank, and Yes Bank, the RBI is now focused on involving smaller banks in the initiative.
During a recent meeting with RBI officials, technology heads of state-owned banks were advised to e‚Ä¶

entry.title: With Crumbling Economic Fundamentals, The Future Of Bitcoin Adoption In Norway Is Bright
entry.summary:
This is an opinion editorial by Rune √òstg√•rd and Alexander Ellefsen, financial writers based in Norway. Although we don‚Äôt have exact numbers on Bitcoin adoption globally, we do know that the global average cryptocurrency adoption rate was estimated to be at about 12% in 2022 and that bitcoin currently has about half of the total market cap of the global cryptocurrency market. Turkey (27.1%) and Argentina (23.5%) topped the 2022 adoption list, and the countries with the most inflation seem to have the highest adoption rates. The oil-rich nation of Norway is at 8% cryptocurrency adoption, which is just two-thirds of the global average. Considering that it has a rather tech-savvy population, this is surprisingly low. The following factors might provide some explanation:
The official consume‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bitcoin Consolidates At $30,000 As Network Congestion Clears
Russian Parliament Passes Vital ‚ÄúDigital Ruble‚Äù Legislation With Plans To Start Tests In August
Cathie Wood reduces her position in Coinbase: ARK sells $12 million in the stock
Bitcoin, Ethereum Technical Analysis: Bitcoin Pushes Towards $31,000 as US Inflation Is Expected to Fall
entry.summary:
Bitcoin moved towards $31,000 on Wednesday, ahead of June‚Äôs inflation report from the United States. Consumer prices are expected to fall to 3.1%, down from May‚Äôs reading of 4.0%. Ethereum also edged higher, as the cryptocurrency closed in on the $1,900 mark.
Bitcoin
Bitcoin (BTC) neared $31,000 in today‚Äôs session, as traders were optimistic ahead of upcoming inflation data from the United States.
Following a low of $30,358.10 on Tuesday, BTC/USD jumped to an intraday high of $30,831.81 earlier in the day.
Today‚Äôs move resulted in the world‚Äôs largest cryptocurrency breaking out of a key resistance level of $30,800.
Bitcoin chart by TradingView
Price has since fallen below this point, as the relative strength index (RSI) neared a ceiling at 62.00.
The index is now hovering at 61.98, with bulls hoping that there will be a breakout following the release of the consumer price index (CPI).
Should this occur, the price target will likely be at a resistance of $31,400.
Ethereum
Ethereum (ETH) also edged higher on hump-day, with the price once again closing in on the $1,900 zone.
So far today, ETH/USD peaked at $1,895.08, which was nearly 2% higher than Tuesday‚Äôs low at $1,863.22.
Unlike bitcoin, ethereum‚Äôs 14-day RSI has moved beyond its own ceiling of 52.00, and as of writing is tracking at 53.42.
Ethereum chart by TradingView
This comes despite the 10-day (red) moving average (MA) being on the cusp of a downward crossover with the blue 25-day MA.
A crossover of this kind will likely be a bearish signal, and could prompt traders to abandon previous long positions.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
Will inflation fall lower than expected? Leave your thoughts in the comments below.

entry.title: Revolutionizing Fiat Payments: How Stablecoins Empower Africa and South America
entry.summary: Stablecoins, a sort of cryptocurrency meant to maintain a stable value, have received a lot of interest because of its potential to revolutionize financial institutions all around the world. Stablecoins offer a possible alternative in places where traditional currency payments meet issues, such as Africa and South America. This article examines the revolutionary effect of stablecoins in supporting fiat payments, promoting financial inclusion, and stimulating economic growth in these emerging economies. The Importance of Stablecoins Stablecoins combine the benefits of cryptocurrencies, such as transparency, security, and cheap transaction costs, with the volatility associated with other digital assets. Their value is linked to a stable asset, such as a national curren‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Are Seeing A Bullish Divergence In This Metric
entry.summary:
A bullish divergence may be forming for both Bitcoin and Ethereum if the data of this on-chain indicator is anything to go by.
Bitcoin & Ethereum Net Realized Profit/Loss Has Turned Negative Recently
According to data from the on-chain analytics firm Santiment, the average trader is moving their BTC and ETH at a slight loss right now. The relevant indicator here is the ‚ÄúNet Realized Profit/Loss‚Äù (NRPL), which keeps track of the net amount of profit or loss that the investors are realizing through their selling currently.
This indicator works by going through the blockchain history of each coin being sold to see what price it was last moved at. If this previous selling price for any coin was less than the current spot price (that it is now being sold at), then that particular coin‚Äôs s‚Ä¶

entry.title: HIVE Rebrands, Announces Expansion Into Cloud Computing Services
entry.summary: HIVE Digital Technologies Ltd., previously known as HIVE Blockchain, has announced that along with its renaming, the company will be focusing on revenue opportunities with its Nvidia graphics processing unit (GPU) cards in cloud compute technology. HIVE plans to utilize a fleet of 38,000 Nvidia GPUs for computational tasks, expanding its revenue channels while seeking to drive advancements in artificial intelligence (AI) applications. According to a press release sent to Bitcoin Magazine, the company intends to enter the rental market for GPU server clusters and launch its new service, HIVE Cloud. ‚ÄúThis cloud service will empower users with access to a virtual instance of a single GPU, a bare-metal server equipped with up to 10 GPUs, or even clusters of multiple servers to provide an array of computing power,‚Äù the press release said. Aydin Kilic, president and CEO of HIVE, highlighted the importance of high-performance computing and GPU processing power in today's AI-driven world. Kilic stated, "Training these tools, from ChatGPT to Midjourney, require high-end GPU compute. As businesses adapt to the new AI world, we believe they will seek companies like HIVE to develop their own AI tools." Executive Chairman Frank Holmes expressed optimism about the potential of GPU computing with Nvidia GPU cards, stating, "We believe the demand has a potential for a high-margin business with annual revenues in the range over $100,000,000." HIVE Digital Technologies stated that it remains ‚Äúdedicated to driving innovation with sustainable, ethically-driven technological solutions,‚Äù and that its current bitcoin mining operations will continue. The company owns data centers in Canada, Sweden and Iceland.

entry.title: Central Banks Controlling Money Is Not Democracy, Balaji Srinivasan Says
entry.summary:
If central banks control all uses of money, this is not democracy, Coinbase‚Äôs ex-tech chief Balaji Srinivasan is convinced. The entrepreneur commented on statements by the head of the Bank of International Settlements during an IMF meeting devoted to cross-border payments.
Balaji Srinivasan Speaks Out Against Centralized Control Over Money Through CBDCs
Former chief technology officer at Coinbase, Balaji Srinivasan, voiced his concerns over central bank digital currencies (CBDCs) allowing monetary authorities to control money. On Tuesday, Srinivasan took to Twitter to say:
When the head of BIS says ‚Äòcentral banks will have absolute control‚Äô over all uses of money, that‚Äôs not democracy.
The American investor was referring to statements made by the General Manager of the Bank of In‚Ä¶

entry.title: South Korean Companies Required to Disclose Crypto Holdings under New Rules
entry.summary: Companies holding or trading cryptocurrencies in South Korea will be required to disclose information about their transactions to the financial regulator, according to the draft rules released by the country's Financial Services Commission (FSC) yesterday (Tuesday). According to the rules, the FSC said that the companies would be required to share information about the amount of digital assets they hold, the characteristics of the assets, as well as their business model. Additionally, the draft rules require companies to disclose profits from cryptocurrencies and the market value of their holdings. Transparency and Accountability The new measures, according to the FSC, aim to improve transparency in accounting for digital assets held by corporations. Additionally, the regul‚Ä¶

entry.title: New York District Attorney Presses Charges Against Hacker For Exploiting Solana DEX
entry.summary:
A hacker has been charged by a New York prosecutor for exploiting a decentralized exchange (DEX) on the Solana blockchain. The individual in question is currently facing legal consequences for allegedly taking undue advantage of vulnerabilities in the DEX‚Äôs smart contracts, causing significant financial losses.
This marks a landmark moment as Damian Williams, district attorney of the Southern District of New York (SDNY) has now filed the first-ever criminal charges for an attack on a smart contract in the decentralized crypto exchange (DEX) sector.
According to an official announcement made on July 11, Shakeeb Ahmed, the accused in the recent smart contract attack case, allegedly exploited his position as a senior security engineer at an international tech firm to commit fraud.
Dis‚Ä¶

entry.title: A Second Round of the Lummis-Gillibrand Crypto Bill Elevates CFTC, Defines DeFi
entry.summary: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) would take a back seat in a crypto oversight bill being re-launched by Sens. Cynthia Lummis (R-Wyo.) and Kirsten Gillibrand (D-N.Y.), which would require that crypto exchanges be overseen by the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) and all stablecoin issuers be regulated depository institutions.
